# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int=3)
    if !isdate(dt) && typeof(bump) <: Int
        return DateTime(millisecond(dt) + (bump * 60 * 60 * 1000))
    else
        throw(DomainError("timezone_bumper works only for DateTime types, not Date types. If you provide an integer as the 'bump' argument, it should also be an Int type."))
    end
end
```
